# Dr. Hamidah Che Abdul Hamid — Education Leader & Researcher

## Overview
Dr. Hamidah Che Abdul Hamid is a Malaysian education leader with 30 years of experience in the public school system. She has led 4 primary schools as Headteacher (Guru Besar), managing up to 1,700 students and 131 staff. She is a PhD candidate at UniSZA (final stage) and has published research on resilience in headteachers.

## PhD Research
- Degree: Doctor of Philosophy (PhD Candidate, Final Stage)
- Institution: Universiti Sultan Zainal Abidin (UniSZA), Terengganu
- Supervisor: Prof. Dr. Puspa Liza Binti Ghazali
- Focus: Educational Leadership & Resilience

## Career Summary
- **1995–2004**: English Language Teacher, Primary Schools, Kelantan
- **2004–2014**: Senior Assistant (Penolong Kanan), Primary Schools, Kelantan
- **2014–2016**: Headteacher, SK Temalir, Kuala Krai (250 students, 35 staff) — Won National PIBG Excellence Award 2016
- **2016–2018**: Headteacher, SK Islah, Kota Bharu (1,400 students, 115 staff) — 300% UPSR improvement, State STEM Principal Award 2018
- **2018–2024**: Headteacher, SK Datu' Hashim, Kota Bharu (1,400 students, 115 staff) — DUTA Digital Award 2021 & 2022
- **2024–Present**: Headteacher, SK Kubang Kerian 3 (SBT), Kota Bharu (1,700 students, 131 staff)

## Education
- PhD Candidate, UniSZA (final stage)
- Master of Education (TESL), UiTM (2007–2011)
- BA English Literature, UPM (2000–2004)
- Diploma Banking Studies, UiTM (1985–1989)

## Interactive Tool: Resilient Leadership Index (RLI) Assessment
Available at: https://drhamidah.com/assessment
- Free self-assessment tool based on Dr. Hamidah's PhD research
- 12 questions across 4 dimensions: Courage & Challenge, Positive Mindset, Focus & Commitment, Community & Support
- 5-point Likert scale, instant personalised results with recommendations
- No registration or email required
- Includes visual score gauge, dimension breakdown, and actionable recommendations

## Publications
1. "Modelling Resilient Educational Leaders for Resilient Schools: Malaysian High Performing Primary School Head Teachers" — JMTP, UniSZA, 2022. DOI: 10.37231/jmtp.2022.3.2.221
2. "Developing of Comprehensive Resilient Educational Model for Head Teachers' High Performance in Malaysia Primary School" — HRMARS, 2023
3. "Resilient Capacity of Malaysian Schools' Headteachers in Adversity: A Review" — Conference Paper, 2021

## Awards
- National-Level PIBG Excellence Award (2016)
- State STEM Principal Award (2018)
- State DUTA Digital Award (2021, 2022)
- Excellent Service Awards (2000, 2007, 2018, 2025)
- Ahli Setia Mahkota Kelantan (A.S.K.) — State Honour

## Availability
Retiring from government service March 2026. Available for education leadership roles in Malaysia's private sector.
